name: Basic Movement
concept: Learn how Karel moves around the world using basic movement commands
objectives: Master the fundamental movement commands: karel_move() and karel_turn_left(). Understand how Karel navigates in a grid world and how to check if the path is clear.

name: Beeper Operations
concept: Learn how to interact with beepers in Karel's world
objectives: Master beeper pickup and placement commands. Learn to detect beepers and use them to solve problems. Practice conditional logic based on beeper presence.

name: Conditional Logic
concept: Use conditional statements to make Karel respond to different situations
objectives: Learn to use if statements with world sensing functions. Practice combining multiple conditions and creating responsive robot behavior.

name: Loops & Repetition
concept: Use loops to make Karel repeat actions efficiently
objectives: Master while loops and for loops. Learn to create efficient solutions that work for different world configurations. Practice loop design patterns.

name: Modular Programming
concept: Break down complex tasks into smaller, manageable functions
objectives: Learn to create and use functions to encapsulate behavior. Understand the importance of function reusability and modular design.

name: Arrays
concept: Learn how to use arrays to store and manipulate collections of data
objectives: Understand array creation, indexing, and manipulation. Learn to iterate over arrays using loops. Practice using arrays to solve problems involving collections of items.

name: Pointers
concept: Learn how to use pointers to reference and manipulate data in C
objectives: Understand pointer syntax and usage. Learn how to pass pointers to functions. Practice using pointers to modify data in place.

name: Data Structures
concept: Learn how to use structs to organize and manage complex data
objectives: Understand struct definition and usage. Learn to create and manipulate structs in C. Practice using structs to model real-world entities.

name: File Operations
concept: Learn how to read and write files in C
objectives: Understand file I/O functions. Learn to read from and write to text files. Practice file manipulation tasks.
